means: 哄骗，欺骗( trick的第三人称单数 )

sentence.Network_en: Tiffany revamped her sitting room with simple decorative tricks.
sentence.Network_cn: 蒂法尼采用简单的装饰技巧将起居室翻新。

sentence.Network_en: He claimed he was the victim of a dirty tricks campaign..
sentence.Network_cn: 他声称他是一场卑鄙的竞选运动的牺牲品。

sentence.Network_en: His secret hobby: performing magic tricks.
sentence.Network_cn: 他私底下有变戏法的嗜好。

entry.def: A trick is an action that is intended to deceive someone.

example.ex: We are playing a trick on a man who keeps bothering me.
example.tran: 我们正在戏弄那个一直烦我的家伙。

entry.def: If someone tricks you, they deceive you, often in order to make you do something.

example.ex: Stephen is going to be pretty upset when he finds out how you tricked him...
example.tran: 如果斯蒂芬发现你怎样欺骗了他，他会非常气愤。

example.ex: His family tricked him into going to Pakistan, and once he was there, they took away his passport...
example.tran: 家人骗他去了巴基斯坦，等到他一到那里，他们就拿走了他的护照。

entry.def: A trick is a clever or skilful action that someone does in order to entertain people.

example.tran: 他表演纸牌戏法给我看。

entry.def: A trick is a clever way of doing something.

example.ex: Tiffany revamped her sitting room with simple decorative tricks.
example.tran: 蒂法尼采用简单的装饰技巧将起居室翻新。

example.ex: It is not just a little trick you can pick up in half an hour.
example.tran: 这不是你半个小时就能学会的小窍门。

entry.def: If something does the trick, it achieves what you wanted.

example.ex: Sometimes a few choice words will do the trick.
example.tran: 有时说几句尖酸刻薄的话就有人听了。

entry.tran: 千方百计;浑身解数;所有的办法
entry.def: If someone tries every trick in the book, they try every possible thing that they can think of in order to achieve something.

example.ex: Companies are using every trick in the book to stay one step in front of their competitors.
example.tran: 各公司想方设法地保持比竞争者领先一步的优势。

entry.def: If you say that something is a trick of the light, you mean that what you are seeing is an effect caused by the way that the light falls on things, and does not really exist in the way that it appears.

example.ex: Her head appears to be on fire but that is only a trick of the light.
example.tran: 她的头部看上去像是着火了，但那只是灯光造成的幻觉。

entry.tran: 无所(不)知;无事(不)晓;把握住任何机会
entry.def: If you say that someone does not miss a trick, you mean that they always know what is happening and take advantage of every situation.

example.ex: When it comes to integrating their transport systems, the French don't miss a trick.
example.tran: 法国人从不放过任何整合其交通系统的机会。

entry.def: The tricks of the trade are the quick and clever ways of doing something that are known by people who regularly do a particular activity.

example.ex: To get you started, we have asked five successful writers to reveal some of the tricks of the trade.
example.tran: 为了让你开始写作，我们邀请了 5 位成功作家向你透露一些写作秘诀。

entry.def: If you say that someone is up to their tricks or up to their old tricks, you disapprove of them because they are behaving in the dishonest or deceitful way in which they typically behave.

example.ex: I have no respect for my father who, having remarried, is still up to his old tricks.
example.tran: 我对父亲没任何敬意，他已经再婚，却依然喜欢耍老把戏。

auth_sentence.content: Old tricks are the best tricks, I guess.
auth_sentence.res_content: Old tricks are the best tricks, I guess.

auth_sentence.content: But there are tricks to thinking so far ahead.
auth_sentence.res_content: But there are tricks to thinking so far ahead.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: But there are tricks to thinking so far ahead.
